subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Thorax: transverse parallel lines of punctures on pronotum present (
Fig. 2
E
), shared with
N. niamensis
and
N. immaculata
; ostiolar ruga auriculate, conspicuous. Abdomen: margins of connexivum with red band, sometimes extended along margins of corium and pronotum, shared with
N. niamensis
and
N. immculata .
Male: ventral rim of pygophore with brims reduced, not continuous at mid line, with a bifid projection (
Fig. 8
K
), as in
N. immaculata ;
paramere trilobate, median lobe carinate (
Fig. 8
K
), as in
N. immaculata .
Female: posterior margins with gonocoxites 8 straight; basal half of laterotergites 9 laterally concave and medially convex (
Fig. 16
K
).
